added_lines: import copyBASE_VANILLA_DESC = { 'NODES': { 'master1': { 'count': 1, 'node_processes': ['namenode', 'resourcemanager', 'hiveserver'] }, 'master2': { 'count': 1, 'node_processes': ['oozie', 'historyserver', 'secondarynamenode'] }, 'worker1': { 'count': 1, 'node_processes': ['datanode', 'nodemanager'], 'node_configs': { 'MapReduce': { 'yarn.app.mapreduce.am.resource.mb': 256, 'yarn.app.mapreduce.am.command-opts': '-Xmx256m' 'YARN': { 'yarn.scheduler.minimum-allocation-mb': 256, 'yarn.scheduler.maximum-allocation-mb': 1024, 'yarn.nodemanager.vmem-check-enabled': False } } } }, 'cluster_configs': { 'HDFS': { 'dfs.replication': 1 } } } BASE_SPARK_DESC = { 'NODES': { 'master1': { 'count': 1, 'node_processes': ['namenode', 'master'] }, 'worker1': { 'count': 1, 'node_processes': ['datanode', 'slave'] } }, 'cluster_configs': { 'HDFS': { 'dfs.replication': 1 } } } DEFAULT_TEMPLATES = { 'vanilla': OrderedDict([ ('2.6.0', copy.deepcopy(BASE_VANILLA_DESC)), ('2.7.1', copy.deepcopy(BASE_VANILLA_DESC)), ('1.0.0', copy.deepcopy(BASE_SPARK_DESC)), ('1.3.1', copy.deepcopy(BASE_SPARK_DESC))

subject: Add port 'up' and 'down' notification
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-29 20:00:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/85d3a96de7b5833c035e41ae89a32cf1a351fd7e', 'message': "Add port 'up' notification

This adds the ability to watch for OVSDB events and take action
when they match specific conditions.

Currently, the mech_driver just watches for ports it creates to
be marked 'up'. The event watcher for that port is then deleted.
This ensures that when running multiple servers, duplicate
notifications are not sent.

If the server died after the neutron port was created, but before
the notifcation happened, the notification would never be sent.
TaskFlow could probably take care of that case in future iterations.
Another option would be to look for 'inactive' neutron ports at
startup, and compare with the OVN db, but if multiple servers are
started at the same time, multiple notifications would be sent.

Change-Id: Ib7e1ebbbbd430a46aead2402e8b7543b5d73806e
Depends-On: I9d98666cb476504669e3fd929a51e7f58ccbbd9c
Depends-On: I8d2884fe32f9ccdcd7539366e0baf055a232f2cd

"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2015-06-27 17:09:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/d3ff65fd20c1fb6b2e948e6e954942bcecfeed43', 'message': "Add port 'up' notification

This adds the ability to watch for OVSDB events and take action
when they match specific conditions.

Currently, the mech_driver just watches for ports it creates to
be marked 'up'. The event watcher for that port is then deleted.
This ensures that when running multiple servers, duplicate
notifications are not sent.

If the server died after the neutron port was created, but before
the notifcation happened, the notification would never be sent.
TaskFlow could probably take care of that case in future iterations.
Another option would be to look for 'inactive' neutron ports at
startup, and compare with the OVN db, but if multiple servers are
started at the same time, multiple notifications would be sent.

Change-Id: Ib7e1ebbbbd430a46aead2402e8b7543b5d73806e
Depends-On: I9d98666cb476504669e3fd929a51e7f58ccbbd9c
Depends-On: I8d2884fe32f9ccdcd7539366e0baf055a232f2cd
Closes-bug: 1457571
Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py

"}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2015-12-27 08:48:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/231da00061ed75539057df18acf650609c24e52d', 'message': "Add port 'up' and 'down' notification

This adds the ability to watch for OVSDB events and take action
when they match specific conditions.

This patch handles the Logical_Port.up updates
 - At startup, it catches the initial 'create' events from
   ovsdb server and updates the port status if not in sync.
 - If the Logical_Port.up changes from False to True
   it sets the port status to 'ACTIVE' so that neutron server
   can send 'network-vif-plugged' event to nova.
 - If the Logical_Port.up changes from True to False
   it sets the port status to 'DOWN' so that neutron server
   can send 'network-vif-unplugged' event to nova.

When the port is created, it sets the status to 'DOWN' by default.

Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib7e1ebbbbd430a46aead2402e8b7543b5d73806e
Closes-bug: #1457571

commit_message:
Add port 'up' and 'down' notification

This adds the ability to watch for OVSDB events and take action
when they match specific conditions.

This patch handles the Logical_Port.up updates
 - At startup, it catches the initial 'create' events from
   ovsdb server and updates the port status if not in sync.
 - If the Logical_Port.up changes from False to True
   it sets the port status to 'ACTIVE' so that neutron server
   can send 'network-vif-plugged' event to nova.
 - If the Logical_Port.up changes from True to False
   it sets the port status to 'DOWN' so that neutron server
   can send 'network-vif-unplugged' event to nova.

To ensure that only one neutron-server handles the OVSDB events
it uses the ovsdb lock.

When the port is created, it sets the status to 'DOWN' by default.

Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib7e1ebbbbd430a46aead2402e8b7543b5d73806e
Closes-bug: #1457571
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/26/178826/26 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron import contextfrom neutron import managerclass PortStateUpEvent(impl_idl_ovn.RowEvent): ONETIME = True def __init__(self, port_id): self.port_id = port_id table = 'Logical_Port' events = (self.ROW_CREATE, self.ROW_UPDATE) conditions = (('name', '=', port_id), ('up', '=', True)) super(PortStateUpEvent, self).__init__(events, table, *conditions) def run(self, event, row, old): plg = manager.NeutronManager.get_plugin() ctx = context.get_admin_context() plg.update_port_status(ctx, self.port_id, n_const.PORT_STATUS_ACTIVE) self._ovn.watch_event(PortStateUpEvent(port['id'])) self.vif_details)

commit_message:
Pin pip to <8 for openstackci-beaker jobs

These jobs install pip packages system-wide but some dependencies
conflict with some things that we still have installed in packages.
Pin pip to < version 8 until we can fix that.

Change-Id: Ic3ae09df09be0c06cb0735a06d9fb082e78d11d1

commit_message:
Update Liberty SHAs - 21 Jan 2016

Updates all repo SHAs to open up work on 12.0.5

The global-requirement-pin entry for pip is removed as it is already
catered for in the pip_install role and the repeated entry is not
required.

Some projects name their paste config files with an underscore
instead of a dash. This patch ensures that the source-branch-updater
includes those files too when checking for updates.

The following CVE fix is included:

OSSA-2016-003: Heat denial of service through template-validate
https://security.openstack.org/ossa/OSSA-2016-003.html

Change-Id: I168d1ec9d6a0364d05ae65c3d8e53f1b16d51623

commit_message:
Add update yaml backward compatibe with PublicVirtualIP on ctlplane

In previous releases, when not using network isolation, we used to create
two different VIPs for the ControlVirtualIP and the PublicVirtualIP both on
the ctlplane network. Later we moved into a configuration with a single
VIP instead so we need a compatibility yaml for those updating from old
versions which preserves both the IPs; one of the two is deleted
otherwise.

Also updates README.md with a short description of the use case.

Change-Id: Iae08b938a255bf563d3df2fdc0748944a9868f8e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/56/257856/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: **update-from-publicvip-on-ctlplane.yaml** To be used if the PublicVirtualIP resource was an additional VIP on the 'ctlplane' network (not using network isolation, updating from 7.0).

commit_message:
Allow keystonemiddleware context for authentication

Enables Castellan to obtain context from keystonemiddleware.
Keystonemiddleware uses the attribute project_id while
oslo.context uses tenant. Also removes non-necessary
fields from identity.v3.Token.

Change-Id: I5d39b6db120349857e409ae4bfbb72ae1540227e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/castellan refs/changes/71/235671/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if hasattr(context, 'tenant') and context.tenant: project_id = context.tenant elif hasattr(context, 'project_id') and context.project_id: project_id = context.project_id else: msg = u._("Unable to create Barbican Client without project_id " "or tenant attribute in context object.") auth = self._get_keystone_auth(context, project_id) def _get_keystone_auth(self, context, project_id): project_id=project_id)
deleted_lines: if not hasattr(context, 'tenant') or context.tenant is None: msg = u._("Unable to create Barbican Client without tenant " "attribute in context object.") auth = self._get_keystone_auth(context) def _get_keystone_auth(self, context): # TODO(kfarr): support keystone v2 project_id=context.tenant, domain_id=context.user_domain, project_domain_id=context.project_domain)

commit_message:
Broken link in file mako_templates.py

This fix is for the documentation section of file 'mako_templates.py'
where the link to OWASP Cross Site Scripting is broken because the last
close parenthesis character is being truncated from the URL. This
results in the message "There is currently no text in this page"
being displayed.

Change-Id: I882662a7be13861b1227eb3fbd95f4884f536d77
Closes-Bug: #1536713

commit_message:
Rename pep8 to linters test

The pep8 tests often does more than calling pep8, rename it to use the new
linters standard job for all lint like jobs.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/78/269878/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. Obtain the tenant ID. For example: .. code-block:: console $ tenant=$(openstack project show -f value -c id TENANT_NAME) #. List the default quotas for a tenant (project): For example: .. code-block:: console $ cinder quota-defaults $tenant#. View Block Storage service quotas for a tenant (project): $ cinder quota-show TENANT_ID $ cinder quota-show $tenant $ cinder quota-usage TENANT_ID For example: .. code-block:: console $ cinder quota-usage $tenant $ cinder quota-delete TENANT_ID #. To update Block Storage service quotas for an existing tenant (project) $ cinder quota-update --QUOTA_NAME QUOTA_VALUE TENANT_ID Replace QUOTA_NAME with the quota that is to be updated; NEW_VALUE with the required new value and TENANT_ID with required tenant ID $ cinder quota-show $tenant $ cinder quota-delete TENANT_ID $ cinder service-disable HOST_NAME BINARY_NAME $ cinder-manage service remove BINARY_NAME HOST_NAME
deleted_lines: #. List the default quotas for all projects:#. View Block Storage service quotas for a project. $ cinder quota-show TENANT_NAME $ cinder quota-show tenant01 $ cinder quota-usage tenantID $ cinder quota-delete tenantID#. To update Block Storage service quotas, place the tenant ID in a variable. $ tenant=$(openstack project show -f value -c id tenantName) #. Update a particular quota value. .. code-block:: console $ cinder quota-update --quotaName NewValue tenantID $ cinder quota-show tenant01 $ cinder quota-delete tenantID $ cinder service-disable <host> <binary> $ cinder-manage service remove <binary> <host>

commit_message:
remove python 2.6 trove classifier

OpenStack projects are no longer being tested under Python 2.6, so
remove the trove classifier implying that this project supports 2.6.

Change-Id: I1f8cc2d5d25a2e00b7ad4d12b013b69695536ab8

commit_message:
Deprecated tox -downloadcache option removed

Caching is enabled by default from pip version 6.0

More info:
https://testrun.org/tox/latest/config.html#confval-downloadcache=path
https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install/#caching

Change-Id: I0a6561c0d667b1310cd544f1b1ec4c019ba16197

commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirements

argparse was external in python 2.6 but not anymore, remove it from
requirements.

This should help with pip 8.0 that gets confused in this situation.
Installation of the external argparse is not needed.

Change-Id: Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d

commit_message:
Rename ceph-mon bootstrap container to avoid conflict

Ceph-mon bootstrap container shares the same name of `ceph_mon` with
real ceph-mon service. When bootstrapping, it will sleep forever for the
purpose of distribute rings. Later on, when starting real `ceph_mon`
service, kolla_docker module will take bootstrap container as real one
because bootstrap container has a super set of env variables and
kolla_docker doesn't do strict comparing of env variable items.

This change follows the pattern of other bootstrap containers and rename
to use `bootstrap_ceph_mon` to avoid conflict.

Co-Authored-By: Sam Yaple <sam@yaple.net>

Change-Id: I0082820900928c42f9cc778ffd705980fea9ad1c
Closes-Bug: #1535140
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/17/268817/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
carbonara: allow to split AggregatedTimeSerie

This adds get_split_key() that returns a key for a (timestamp, sampling)
tuple, and a configurable chunk size.

This split key is then used to split a TimeSerie in several smaller
TimeSerie based on that key and range between two keys.

Change-Id: I6b172cae7812fdccd93cbf0318938a228d112270

added_lines: (pandas.Timestamp(ts).value // freq) * freq) rounded = self._round_timestamp(self.ts.index[-1], self.block_size.delta.value) POINTS_PER_SPLIT = 14400 @classmethod def get_split_key(cls, timestamp, sampling, chunk_size=POINTS_PER_SPLIT): return cls._round_timestamp(timestamp, freq=sampling * chunk_size * 10e8) def split(self, chunk_size=POINTS_PER_SPLIT): groupby = self.ts.groupby(functools.partial( self.get_split_key, sampling=self.sampling, chunk_size=chunk_size)) keys = groupby.groups.keys() keys.sort() for i, ts in enumerate(keys): if i + 1 == len(keys): yield ts, TimeSerie(self.ts[ts:]) elif i + 1 < len(keys): t = self.ts[ts:keys[i + 1]] del t[t.index[-1]] yield ts, TimeSerie(t) @classmethod def from_timeseries(cls, timeseries, sampling=None, max_size=None, aggregation_method='mean'): ts = pandas.Series() for t in timeseries: ts = ts.combine_first(t.ts) return cls(ts, sampling=sampling, max_size=max_size, aggregation_method=aggregation_method) freq=self.sampling * 10e8)) from_ = self._round_timestamp(from_timestamp, self.sampling * 10e8)
deleted_lines: (pandas.Timestamp(ts).value // freq.delta.value) * freq.delta.value) rounded = self._round_timestamp(self.ts.index[-1], self.block_size) freq=self._sampling)) from_ = self._round_timestamp(from_timestamp, self._sampling)

commit_message:
notification.Audit.update needed to be changed from service_id to ref['id']

Notification.Audit.update needed to be changed from
service_id to ref['id'] when create_service is
called with service_id and service_ref parameters,
once service_id may be not equal to ref['id'].
We should use ref['id'] instead of service_id
when calling notifications.Audit.updated'.
Closes-Bug: 1517751

Change-Id: I18d57669400f5a241a04f1803b98f6b90e4edf44

commit_message:
openstack-doc-tools,openstackdocstheme: Use linters

Rename pep8 to linters job for documentation tool repositories.

Also removes unneeded '' around requirements job.

commit_message:
Do not use StringIO and cStringIO in python3

In python3, the StringIO and cStringIO modules are gone.
The io module does it for you.
ref:http://www.diveintopython3.net/porting-code-to-python-3-with-2to3.html

Change-Id: I92eb7ce053f4c6a3909383efc3d535fdd0a31511
Blueprint: neutron-python3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/26/270326/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six body_iter = six.StringIO(body_str)

commit_message:
Heat Docker agent built with Dockerfile

This includes a Dockerfile which builds the heat-docker-agent container
with all the necessary bits to make it work.  This also includes fixes
for VLAN networking to use.

Change-Id: I2f4edf0a91bddede810ddf1765296be23c4bbebd
Co-Authored-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/17/253217/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FROM centos:7 MAINTAINER "Jeff Peeler" <jpeeler@redhat.com> ENV container docker ENV DOCKER_HOST unix:///var/run/docker.sock RUN yum -y install http://rdoproject.org/repos/openstack-liberty/rdo-release-liberty.rpm RUN yum update -y \ && yum clean all RUN yum install -y \ initscripts \ dhcp-client \ ethtool \ NetworkManager # We shouldn't need python-zaqarclient here, the for os-collect-config # should pull it in but it's not doing that.. RUN yum install -y \ openstack-tripleo-puppet-elements \ openstack-tripleo-image-elements \ openstack-heat-templates \ openstack-puppet-modules \ os-apply-config \ os-collect-config \ os-refresh-config \ os-net-config \ jq \ python-zaqarclient \ gcc \ libyaml-devel \ python-devel \ python-pip \ openvswitch \ puppet # heat-config-docker-compose # TODO: fix! yet another requirement for docker-compose RUN pip install dpath functools32 RUN yum install -y \ docker \ python-pip RUN pip install -U docker-compose RUN yum clean all # Heat config setup. RUN mkdir -p /var/lib/heat-config/hooks RUN ln -sf /usr/share/openstack-heat-templates/software-config/elements/heat-config-puppet/install.d/hook-puppet.py \ /var/lib/heat-config/hooks/puppet RUN ln -sf /usr/share/openstack-heat-templates/software-config/elements/heat-config-script/install.d/hook-script.py \ /var/lib/heat-config/hooks/script RUN ln -sf /usr/share/openstack-heat-templates/software-config/elements/heat-config-docker-compose/install.d/hook-docker-compose.py \ /var/lib/heat-config/hooks/docker-compose # Install puppet modules RUN mkdir -p /etc/puppet/modules RUN ln -sf /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules/* /etc/puppet/modules/ # And puppet hiera RUN mkdir -p /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/etc/puppet RUN ln -sf /usr/share/tripleo-puppet-elements/hiera/os-apply-config/etc/puppet/hiera.yaml /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/etc/puppet/ RUN ln -sf /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml /etc/hiera.yaml # Configure os-* RUN mkdir -p /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d RUN ln -sf /usr/share/tripleo-image-elements/os-apply-config/os-refresh-config/configure.d/20-os-apply-config \ /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d/ RUN ln -sf /usr/share/openstack-heat-templates/software-config/elements/heat-config-docker-compose/os-refresh-config/configure.d/50-heat-config-docker-compose \ /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d/ RUN ln -sf /usr/share/openstack-heat-templates/software-config/elements/heat-config/os-refresh-config/configure.d/55-heat-config \ /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d/ RUN ln -sf /usr/share/tripleo-puppet-elements/hiera/os-refresh-config/configure.d/40-hiera-datafiles \ /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/configure.d/ RUN mkdir -p /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d RUN ln -sf /usr/share/tripleo-image-elements/os-refresh-config/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/99-refresh-completed \ /usr/libexec/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/ RUN mkdir -p /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/var/run/heat-config RUN echo "{{deployments}}" > /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/var/run/heat-config/heat-config RUN ln -sf /usr/share/openstack-heat-templates/software-config/elements/heat-config/bin/heat-config-notify \ /usr/local/bin/ RUN mkdir -p /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/etc/os-net-config/ RUN ln -sf /usr/share/tripleo-image-elements/os-net-config/os-apply-config/etc/os-net-config/config.json \ /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/etc/os-net-config/ RUN mkdir -p /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/etc/ RUN ln -sf /usr/share/tripleo-image-elements/os-collect-config/os-apply-config/etc/os-collect-config.conf \ /usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/etc # This is a script which: # - Copies the existing network interface configs from the host to the agent. # - Configures os-net-config # - Runs os-net-config in the agent. # # All of this is triggered from the heat templates. ADD run-os-net-config /usr/local/bin/ # create volumes to share the host directories VOLUME [ "/var/lib/cloud"] VOLUME [ "/var/lib/heat-cfntools" ] CMD /usr/bin/os-collect-config

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 15:16:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config/commit/130492c0d718b0cec3baab8fa43c012690493540', 'message': 'Don't set project_domain if not project scoped

commit_message:
Don't set project_domain if not project scoped

The code to expand domain_{name,id} to {user,project}_domain_{name,id}
is flawed in that it sets a project_domain_{name,id} even if a
project_{name,id} is not set. There is a valid use case for not having
a project_{name,id} - specifically getting a domain-scoped token.

In the case where we do not set a project, check for that and don't make
further assumptions that the domain input needs to be "fixed".

Closes-Bug: #1535676
Change-Id: I825fe4bc375687208bb176bb5990c23fe87c8f9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/04/269704/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _project_scoped(self, cloud): return ('project_id' in cloud or 'project_name' in cloud or 'project_id' in cloud['auth'] or 'project_name' in cloud['auth']) if not self._project_scoped(cloud): if target_key in cloud and target_key not in cloud['auth']: cloud['auth'][target_key] = cloud.pop(target_key) continue

commit_message:
Tighten frontend nginx and haproxy TLS ciphersuites

To get rid from last VUWACONA vulnerabilities, add tight protocol
and ciphersuite requisitions on UI HTTPS nginx and TLS-aware HAProxy
instances.

Also create new Diffie-Hellmann parameters for frontend nginx.

Closes-Bug: #1532778
Change-Id: Ib851038b883a84f4d59c3e4db8cc25608e215821
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/71/268171/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'nailgun::nginx-nailgun' do context 'when TLS enabled' do let :params do { :staticdir => '/var/www/static/', :logdumpdir => '/var/log/', :ssl_enabled => true, } end it 'should create new Diffie-Hellmann parameters file' do should contain_exec('create new dhparam file') end end end

commit_message:
compute: convert manager to use nova.objects.ImageMeta

Update the virt driver API so that all methods with an
'image_meta' parameter take a nova.objects.ImageMeta
instance instead of a dict.

NB, this will break out of tree virt drivers until they
convert their code to use the new object.

Blueprint: mitaka-objects
Change-Id: I75465a2029b53aa4d338b80619ed7380e0d19e6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/189685/35 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: image_info = test_utils.get_test_image_info(None, instance_ref) self.connection.spawn(self.ctxt, instance_ref, image_info, image_meta = {} image_meta = {}

commit_message:
Update README to RST

This allows the tooling used by the release management team parse the
content to grab links to bug trackers and docs.

Also updated the sample test command to a working one

Change-Id: I1dcfb2b5ae3ba07fbaf6eaabfef1d9e7da778400
Closes-Bug: #1532735
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/91/267091/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =================== OpenStack Designate =================== Designate is an OpenStack project, providing DNSaaS. IRC: #openstack-dns Installation: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/designate/getting-started.html Development =========== Designate follows the `OpenStack Gerrit Workflow`_ Setup ----- Setup a working environment: .. code-block:: shell git clone https://github.com/openstack/designate.git cd designate virtualenv .venv . .venv/bin/activate pip install -r requirements.txt -r test-requirements.txt python setup.py develop Building Docs ------------- To build the documentation from the restructured text source, do the following: .. code-block:: shell cd doc pip install -r requirements.txt sphinx-build source/ build/html/ now point your browser at html/index.html (the official documentation is published to `docs.openstack.org`_ by the maintainers. Contributing ------------ Install the git-review package to make life easier .. code-block:: shell pip install git-review Branch, work, & submit: .. code-block:: shell # cut a new branch, tracking master git checkout --track -b bug/id origin/master # work work work git add stuff git commit # rebase/squash to a single commit before submitting git rebase -i # submit git-review Testing ------- Execute a single test using py27 (test is CentralServiceTest.test_count_domains) .. code-block:: shell tox -e py27 -- designate.tests.test_central.test_service.CentralServiceTest.test_count_zones_policy_check * Free software: Apache license * Documentation: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/designate * Source: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/designate * Bugs: http://bugs.launchpad.net/designate .. _OpenStack Gerrit Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#development-workflow .. _docs.openstack.org: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/designate

commit_message:
Add the ability to grab processes checks by user

This will allow us to grab detailed process metrics for a group
of processes that are all owned by the same user.

Change-Id: If89fdc0e81973810307c21ab5d24b084d03704a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/64/265464/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Process checks can be performed to both verify that a set of named processes are running on the local system and grab system level metrics on those processes. The YAML file `process.yaml` contains the list of processes that are checked. The processes can be identified using a pattern match (which has the option for exact match on the process name) or by user that owns the process. A Python script `process.py` runs each execution cycle to check that required processes are alive. If the process is running a value of 0 is sent, otherwise a value of 1 is sent to the Monasca API. Each process entry consists of one primary key: name. Besides that either search_string or user must be set. Optionally, if an exact match on name is required and the search_string is being used, the exact_match boolean can be added to the entry and set to True. - name: monasca_agent user: mon-agent detailed: true
deleted_lines: Process checks can be performed to verify that a set of named processes are running on the local system. The YAML file `process.yaml` contains the list of processes that are checked. The processes can be identified using a pattern match or exact match on the process name. A Python script `process.py` runs each execution cycle to check that required processes are alive. If the process is running a value of 0 is sent, otherwise a value of 1 is sent to the Monasca API. Each process entry consists of two primary keys: name and search_string. Optionally, if an exact match on name is required, the exact_match boolean can be added to the entry and set to True.

commit_message:
Drop using urlparse module for python3

Module urlparse does not exist in python3.
use six.moves.urllib to fix python2,3 compatibility issues

Change-Id: I15ea7f97c1cfaf5bb48cb4e4cfe5c65f431338d2
Blueprint: neutron-python3

deleted_lines: import urlparse endpoint_parts = urlparse.urlparse(self.endpoint) url_parts = urlparse.urlparse(url)

commit_message:
Remove usage of user project caching

The caching is done only per process, so the cleanup during logout
does not really work since the during could be handled by another
process. So the cache will just keep on growing.

Change-Id: I793fbee44eb5f9befc316efe6716971b0e32172b
Partial-Bug: #1451943
(cherry picked from commit 6f83d38da2b2eed5ac5c8854c05f6e6b029fc215)

Change-Id: I31a1353d161e5e5687332cd8300ba5dd4f992a67
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-21 06:27:47.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/763a287fabddce5d437d07b66a9b45b8e220487c', 'message': 'pbr > 1.6 to avoid pip 8 distutils issue

"Detected a distutils installed project" issue is hitting
for argparse for specs repo.

commit_message:
pbr > 1.6 to avoid pip 8 distutils issue

"Detected a distutils installed project" issue is hitting
for argparse for specs repo.
In case of nova specs repo it comes from testtools.

As a workaround, making pbr version > 1.0 so that venv having pip
< 8 and works fine. pbr < 1.0 endup with pip 8 and fails.

pbr < 1.0 has pip explicitly in requirement.txt and trigger
to update the pip to 8.

pbr > 1.0 does not have the requirement.txt thing and does not
trigger pip updates for venv.

This is issue with all specs repo having distutils installed projects
because g-r requirement update does not sync the specs repo requirements.
But that is another thing can be fixed if there is no reason of not
updating specs requirements.

Change-Id: I31a1353d161e5e5687332cd8300ba5dd4f992a67
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/06/270606/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

carbonara: allow to create TimeSerie from existing ts

This allows to create TimeSerie instances with already existing Pandas
timeseries.

added_lines: def __init__(self, ts=None): if ts is None: ts = pandas.Series() self.ts = ts.groupby(level=0).last().sort_index() @classmethod def from_data(cls, timestamps=None, values=None): return cls(pandas.Series(values, timestamps)) return cls.from_data(*zip(*timestamps_values)) return cls.from_data(*cls._timestamps_and_values_from_dict(d['values'])) def __init__(self, ts=None, block_size=None, back_window=0): super(BoundTimeSerie, self).__init__(ts) @classmethod def from_data(cls, timestamps=None, values=None, block_size=None, back_window=0): return cls(pandas.Series(values, timestamps), block_size=block_size, back_window=back_window) return cls.from_data(timestamps, values, block_size=d.get('block_size'), back_window=d.get('back_window')) def __init__(self, ts=None, max_size=None, super(AggregatedTimeSerie, self).__init__(ts) @classmethod def from_data(cls, timestamps=None, values=None, max_size=None, sampling=None, aggregation_method='mean'): return cls(pandas.Series(values, timestamps), max_size=max_size, sampling=sampling, aggregation_method=aggregation_method) return cls.from_data(timestamps, values, max_size=d.get('max_size'), sampling=d.get('sampling'), aggregation_method=d.get('aggregation_method', 'mean'))

commit_message:
Look for device holes that can be reused when adding new device.

Change-Id: I1980ebdd9dc89848173d8ca2fe2afb74029dcfa2
Closes-Bug: 1532276
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/61/265461/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _add_dev_delete_first_n(self, add_dev_count, n): rb = ring.RingBuilder(8, 3, 1) dev_names = ['sda', 'sdb', 'sdc', 'sdd', 'sde', 'sdf'] for i in range(add_dev_count): if i < len(dev_names): dev_name = dev_names[i] else: dev_name = 'sda' rb.add_dev({'id': i, 'region': 0, 'zone': 0, 'ip': '127.0.0.1', 'port': 6000, 'weight': 1.0, 'device': dev_name}) rb.rebalance() rb.pretend_min_part_hours_passed() # remove first n for i in range(n): rb.remove_dev(i) rb.pretend_min_part_hours_passed() rb.rebalance() return rb def test_reuse_of_dev_holes_without_id(self): add_dev_count = 6 rb = self._add_dev_delete_first_n(add_dev_count, add_dev_count-3) # add without specifying id new_dev_id = rb.add_dev({'region': 0, 'zone': 0, 'ip': '127.0.0.1', 'port': 6000, 'weight': 1.0, 'device': 'sda'}) self.assertTrue(new_dev_id < add_dev_count) def test_reuse_of_dev_holes_with_id(self): add_dev_count = 6 rb = self._add_dev_delete_first_n(add_dev_count, add_dev_count-3) # add specifying id exp_new_dev_id = 2 try: new_dev_id = rb.add_dev({'id': exp_new_dev_id, 'region': 0, 'zone': 0, 'ip': '127.0.0.1', 'port': 6000, 'weight': 1.0, 'device': 'sda'}) self.assertEqual(new_dev_id, exp_new_dev_id) except exceptions.DuplicateDeviceError: self.fail("device hole not reused")

subject: VMware: improve instance names on VC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-22 13:59:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/36ad5981fdaf9c4bc9d6ed136c9b7be2c9f06319', 'message': 'VMware: improve instance names on VC

Up until now the instance name of the VC was the UUID of the instance.
This is very confusing for administrators and they would like some
context for the VM.
This will now be:
 <display-name> (<instance-uuid>)

Once the the instance is created we will perform a rename. The reason
for this is that the disks are all stored under a folder on the datastore

commit_message:
VMware: improve instance names on VC

Up until now the instance name of the VM on the VC was the UUID of
the instance. This is very confusing for administrators and they
would like some context for the VM.

This will now be:
 <display-name> (<instance-uuid>)

Once the the instance is created we will perform a rename. The reason
for this is that the disks are all stored under a folder on the datastore
that has the name of the instance UUID.

NOTE: this is only for the display on the VC. The search for the VM's
      is done via the instanceUUID configured on the VM. If that fails
      then the nvp.uuid extra spec is used for the search.

This completed the blueprint vmware-better-display-names

Closes-bug: #1330873

Change-Id: Ibeb000f4c1d88fa296390143b0cf98e05e735086
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/08/166608/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_vm_name(display_name, id): if display_name: return '%s (%s)' % (display_name[:41], id[:36]) else: return id[:36] def _get_vm_rename_spec(client_factory, instance): rename_spec = client_factory.create('ns0:VirtualMachineConfigSpec') rename_spec.name = _get_vm_name(instance.display_name, instance.uuid) return rename_spec def rename_vm(session, vm_ref, instance): rename_spec = _get_vm_rename_spec(session.vim.client.factory, instance) reconfigure_vm(session, vm_ref, rename_spec)

subject: Create a new object instead of querying the default one
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-04 17:23:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv/commit/a6ee360cc4dfacbf700d2b536dbc327da7d4523b', 'message': 'Create a new object instead of querying the default one

Currently, a WMI Setting Data (Port Allocation, Port VLAN, Port
Security) is created by querying the default object. Under large
scale environments, this can lead to huge execution times, as the
query takes longer to complete. This can lead to late port binding
and missed DHCP requests, leaving the VM with no IP.

A solution for this is to create the needed object (.new()) instead
of querying the default one.

Change-Id: Ib492afe5387373a40d964e76fa6b4b0ee3b5666d

commit_message:
Create a new object instead of querying the default one

Currently, a WMI Setting Data (Port VLAN, Port Security) is created
by querying the default object. Under large scale environments,
this can lead to huge execution times, as the query takes longer to
complete. This can lead to late port binding and missed DHCP
requests, leaving the VM with no IP.

A solution for this is to create the needed object (.new()) instead
of querying the default one.

Change-Id: Ib492afe5387373a40d964e76fa6b4b0ee3b5666d
Partial-Bug: #1505196

commit_message:
Cap keystonemiddleware version

It seems that change f27d7f776e8 caused a bit of havoc. This
patch tries to prove the theory. Discussion [1] for more
details.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-January/084496.html

commit_message:
Have Horizon use internal endpoints

If we have ssl on the public endpoints, Horizon may have trouble
talking to them.  Using the internal endpoints avoids the problem.

Change-Id: I0aae5eca0cfc7f0e1c91246e22f2ce1bf2872f03
(cherry picked from commit e87b7d3bb831b4d97dff02c9af95575d759e090f)

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from stevedore import extension import testtools from bandit.cli import config_generator from bandit.core import test_properties as test def gen_config(name): return {"test": "test data"} @test.takes_config('test') @test.checks('Str') def _test_plugin(context, conf): pass class BanditConfigGeneratorTests(testtools.TestCase): def _make_test_manager(self, plugin): return extension.ExtensionManager.make_test_instance( [extension.Extension('test', None, _test_plugin, None)]) def setUp(self): mngr = self._make_test_manager(mock.MagicMock) self.patchExtMan = mock.patch('stevedore.extension.ExtensionManager') self.mockExtMan = self.patchExtMan.start() self.mockExtMan.return_value = mngr super(BanditConfigGeneratorTests, self).setUp() def tearDown(self): super(BanditConfigGeneratorTests, self).tearDown() self.patchExtMan.stop() def test_get_config_settings(self): settings = config_generator.get_config_settings() self.assertEqual(settings, "test: {test: test data}\n")

In watcher, an audit generates a set of actions which
aims at achieving a given goal (lower energy consumption, ...).
It is possible to configure different strategies in order to achieve
each goal. Each strategy is written as a Python class which produces
a set of actions. Today, the set of possible actions is fixed for a
given version of Watcher and enables optimization algorithms to
include actions such as instance migration, changing hypervisor state,
changing power state (ACPI level, ...).

This patchset allow the applier to use taskflow.

DocImpact
APIImpact

commit_message:
Use taskflow library for building and executing action plans

The aim of this patchset is to integrate taskflow in
the Watcher Applier. Taskflow will help us a lot to make
Action Plan execution easy, consistent, scalable and reliable.

DocImpact

Partially implements: blueprint use-taskflow

Change-Id: I903d6509d74a61ad64e1506b8a7156e6e91abcfb
Closes-Bug: #1535326
Closes-Bug: #1531912

revisions:

commit_message:
Have Horizon use internal endpoints

If we have ssl on the public endpoints, Horizon may have trouble
talking to them.  Using the internal endpoints avoids the problem.

Change-Id: I0aae5eca0cfc7f0e1c91246e22f2ce1bf2872f03
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/36/267836/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Deploy with --libvirt-type qemu

This is required to be able to boot instances on the overcloud.

Change-Id: I41231ff359eb3916f082cf926cf4d87c5a8b0b87
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/48/269848/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # All of our test envs are virtual, so we need to use unaccelerated qemu OVERCLOUD_DEPLOY_ARGS="$OVERCLOUD_DEPLOY_ARGS --libvirt-type qemu"

commit_message:
Run instack-test-overcloud

There are some open questions on the tripleo.sh ping test review,
so in order to get some sort of testing in quickly, let's just run
instack-test-overcloud at the end of CI runs.  Once the tripleo.sh
Heat-based version is ready this can be replaced with it.

I'm intentionally not adding this to tripleo.sh as I want the focus
there to be on the new ping test.  This is just a quick and dirty
way to improve our test coverage.

Change-Id: Ib113f7a0f5e22f64394b2bcc6a28198661704893

As of this writing that is blocked on some packaging issues # though so I'm adding this to expedite testing of deployed overclouds. openstack overcloud image build --type fedora-userneutron net-create ext-net -- --router:external=True neutron subnet-create --allocation-pool start=192.0.2.50,end=192.0.2.70 --gateway 192.0.2.1 --enable_dhcp=False --name external ext-net 192.0.2.0/24 neutron router-create router neutron router-gateway-set router ext-net neutron net-create default-net neutron subnet-create default-net 10.0.0.0/24 --name private neutron router-interface-add router private instack-test-overcloud # End of temporary overcloud testing

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Wire Neutron ML2 plugin and OVS agent settings as arrays""

This reverts commit c495eab279126f54b1d3ebfba2edf12e591527c8.

Fixes are coming that will make this work, but they build on this
change so we need it back in.

Change-Id: Idcb85f5de047fec0692f457b8fd4f2ddc28d1d34

commit_message:
tox: change default target from MongoDB to MySQL

Since we're planning on deprecating non-SQL backends, let's already
switch the default on our development side.

Change-Id: I1cc47388c7aafcee5e8b5f697ba48a7b67e46c5f
Blueprint: only-support-sqlalchemy-in-aodh

commit_message:
sqlalchemy: switch to new oslo.db facade

The SQLAlchemyIndexer is a class with methods, which is not the
standalone-function based calling style that the new enginefacade was designed
for; additionally, it does not use the global engine scope and instead has its
own, which is even disconnectable (do we need that?) So an interim
PerInstanceFacade object is produced locally which ideally should be replaced
with first-class patterns in oslo.db, supporting context on an methods with
"self" as well as supporting self-local transaction facades (if we really need
that?).

Change-Id: I4e60cca3434e4290145a6a38ce6f27a6c7b1d2be
Co-Authored-By: Mike Bayer <mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/69/204669/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[Sahara] Improved flavor paramter for clusters

The flavors for Master and Worker node groups is now configured
separatelly in both scenarios and context.
This allows setting up better balanced clusters when a Master node
may require a bigger flavor than workers. This is almost always a
requirement for plugins like CDH or HDP.

Change-Id: I78f4145fecb327dae06ead02bd1aa85e2ba2b79a

commit_message:
[microversions] Add support for 2.15

With I3f156d5e5df4d9642bb4b0ffac30a6288459ce61 nova introduced
microversion 2.15 which adds two new policies soft-affinty and
soft-anti-affinity for the server-group api.

This patch bumps the nova client microversion support to 2.15.
The novaclient is transparent regarding the policy value of the
server-group api so no further changes are needed. However the
help text of the policies parameter mentioned the possible policies.
This was removed as the current framework does not support providing
different help text for a parameter depending on the microversion.

Implements: blueprint soft-affinity-for-server-group
Change-Id: I739ed1dd3e4c15e28a269c4f980a12a74fb1def0

commit_message:
[microversions] Add support for 2.14

In I54bfa1275e188573c1b95d770d89160a86cdf52c the onSharedStorage
flag is removed from the evacuate API. This patch removes it from
the novaclient as well.

Implements: bp remove-shared-storage-flag-in-evacuate-api
Change-Id: I5ae75fdac226f0246f22a4d5245c1e4952571fc1

commit_message:
Introduce data driven testing

Initial commit that introduces DDT as requirement and
implements it in some obvious test cases.

DDT can ease up error tracing and autogenerates tests on basis of
different input data.

It automatically generates tests like:

    test_create_security_group_rule_with_icmp_type_code_4__0__0
    test_create_security_group_rule_with_icmp_type_code_5__11__None

Change-Id: Ieeac25f73fd4c962883732d64437285ba233175a
Implements: blueprint ddt-testing

commit_message:
Avoid checking for Windows version 10 in vmutilsv2

vmutils10 is used in case of Windows / Hyper-V Server 2016. This
check is pointless in vmutilsv2.

Change-Id: Ida52d23f4d7097622e3bc2d12faf3df37a4aee99
(cherry picked from commit fce6c807ccd958f80b3dd2e0088b0fda7c11018b)

commit_message:
Change job artifact for getting iso version

In Fuel 9.0 there is no version.yaml.txt build artifact
anymore. Modified reporter to use another artifact
'magnet_link.txt', which contains iso file name. Parse
iso name if order to get its version.

Also refactored 'get_version' and related methods a bit,
so version fetching algorithm look more obvious.

Change-Id: I7964de1dba83bf810815f6e0ed00c726aa1d97ad
Closes-bug: #1536628

Fix URLs for CLI Reference and API

Replace link to API Quick Start with link to API reference for nova.

commit_message:
Reduced the complexity of the execute() method

The execute() method is very large - almost 150 lines,
and McCabe's cyclomatic complexity 22.
(watcher/decision_engine/strategy/strategies/basic_consolidation.py)
I extracted some of the functionalities into helper functions
to reduce the length and complexity of execute().
http://openqa.sed.hu/dashboard/index/544838?did=1
Additionally it became more readable as well, without
changing its functionality.

Change-Id: I760929f56e258b87d7f1d4586bcc90665f1e0d8f
Closes-Bug: 1535729

commit_message:
Sync Action resource fields

In watcher blueprint watcher-add-actions-via-conf introduce
updates of Action object. We have to synchronize watcherclient
to be able to display correctly action resource fields on console.

Change-Id: I1ace65ab85ed4422d9c8cd2846cc73d0a0b51e4d
Implements: blueprint watcher-add-actions-via-conf

commit_message:
Adding amqp_durable_queues parameter to neutron configurations

When rabbitmq service quits or crashes it will forget the
queues and messages. To make sure those messages aren't
lost, amqp_durable_quesesneed to added in neutron.conf.

Closes-Bug: #1532798

Change-Id: Ifd4987e5a54f4fea48062790cf4b19a2d4417cc4

commit_message:
Cleanup driver UTs

Create usable instance objects in the driver setup routine so
each test that needs one doesn't have to duplicate the effort.

Removed unused _inst_dict() method from the driver and unit
tests.

Change-Id: I2b79698584b0fd978d9cf044206350485d4f687a

Disable TRACE method for Apache 2.4

Avoiding possible XST attack vector

Change-Id: I3f4d29c71811a3d6240cfa8b9242039c27a6cad7
Closes-Bug: #1533209

subject: [install] Fix heat trustee configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-21 04:21:59.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/heat-install.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/5a3618d4f51a64cc9ef16d9365aa7190b3f5914e', 'message': '[install] Fix heat trustee configuration

The current example config is broken with the default deferred
authentication of trusts - the project_domain_id and project_name
cannot be specified in this section or keystone will throw a
"cannot be scoped to multiple targets" error when we attempt to get
a token scoped to a trust.

Also, the auth_uri is unused by the keystoneclient password auth
plugins, so remove it (it has been a source of confusion in the
referenced bug).

Change-Id: I6305be3c693993de4d16d82fd6de936e92c437c5
Closes-Bug: #1300246
Backport: liberty
(cherry picked from commit 98ef59a59973954f5396df4898ffc1d1df98b9c2)
'}]
commit_message:
[install] Fix heat trustee configuration

The current example config is broken with the default deferred
authentication of trusts - the project_domain_id and project_name
cannot be specified in this section or keystone will throw a
"cannot be scoped to multiple targets" error when we attempt to get
a token scoped to a trust.

Also, the auth_uri is unused by the keystoneclient password auth
plugins, so remove it (it has been a source of confusion in the
referenced bug).

Change-Id: I6305be3c693993de4d16d82fd6de936e92c437c5
Closes-Bug: #1300246
Backport: liberty
(cherry picked from commit 98ef59a59973954f5396df4898ffc1d1df98b9c2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/98/270598/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The audit template UUID should be validated during the creation of an
audit.  An HTTP 400 error is returned to the client if an invalid audit
template UUID is passed as part of the body when creating an audit.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1510188

Change-Id: I0543d22751b77f6641ddef6a7f0f4acce61180fd
'}]
commit_message:
Validate audit template UUID on audit create

The audit template UUID should be validated during the creation of an
audit.  An HTTP 400 error is returned to the client if an invalid audit
template UUID is passed as part of the body when creating an audit.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1510188

Change-Id: I0543d22751b77f6641ddef6a7f0f4acce61180fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/45/270645/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Split log file of mistral services

Adding the option to configure different log files for
mistral services in order to have clearer log files
seperated to engine,api and executor

Change-Id: Ie1106e01206f7c618e5b2ed5a55666718b3e7ec8
Signed-off-by: tshtilma <tomer.shtilman@nokia.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-mistral refs/changes/04/270104/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ExecStart=/usr/bin/mistral-server --server executor --config-file <%= @conf_file %> --log-file <%= @log_file %>

commit_message:
Activate sparse copy for Netapp

Activating sparse copy of files since using
"volume migration" or "retype" the size of the resulting
file is larger than before. Due to the reason that the
sparse blocks in the file are copied over completely. This
is inefficient performance wise and wastes space on the
storage itself.

Closes bug: #1534649

Change-Id: I3be7baf0255d838e6f5e16302c85d318061f4004
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/02/268902/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleteaggregate missing in the doc

deleteaggregate method is not listed in the compute API2.1 doc
we should add this because it's supported.

Adding the API Description

This patch adds the API Description of "Create volume metadata".
Currently, we can use the "Create volume metadata" API.

Change-Id: Ia04e3fc98267422a84beba9ffa7493d2ccebe693
Closes-Bug: #1531099

commit_message:
Add py34 test environment to tox.ini

* Create a whitelist of tests which pass on Python 3: tests-py3.txt
* Run tests on Python 3 using ostestr and the blacklist

Change-Id: I064f2aaf41f3a206cf67f9cadd496ea5e72ec76f
Partially-Implements: blueprint designate-py3

commit_message:
always make upper-constraints available to python jobs

For all the python jobs, always make the constraints available. This
allows projects to have py27 target use constraints without having a
parallel set of jobs.

Change-Id: Ia31bfcda7d7a7756e4fcc51773f39f20e69313df

commit_message:
WIP: Block device tagging

A cloud user boots a VM with two block devices of identical size. One
is a high throughput Cinder volume to be used as database storage, the
other is for the OS. Currently, there is no direct way to tell which
device is which. This patch proposes an optional block device tag that
is set by the user at boot time and is exposed in the metadata.

APIImpact

Implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging
Change-Id: I0ccda0829530660f834c299c4d4c0c6044256550

commit_message:
Implementation of policies in topology template

Implemented policies in topology template. Corrected groups class and
properties. groups will be added in seperate patch.
As of this patch, corrected key names as per spec.
Added validation of keys for policy and groups.
Added functionality (version, targets, description) to PolicyType class

Added testcases : policies for nodetemplates & policies for groups

Partially Implements: blueprint tosca-policies
Co-Authored-By: madhavi <madhavilatha.t@tcs.com >
Change-Id: I22f8c442274fd0c6d361c4cbd1aeacdda3daaeaa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tosca-parser refs/changes/33/262233/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from toscaparser.elements.policytype import PolicyTypefrom toscaparser.utils.gettextutils import _ if entity_name == 'policy_type': type = self.entity_tpl.get('type') if not type: msg = (_('type is not defined for policy %(name)s.') % {'name': name}) ExceptionCollector.appendException( ValidationError(msg)) self.type_definition = PolicyType(type)

commit_message:
Ensure that ansible_processor_vcpus always has a default value

In some cases Ansible does not detect the number of CPU's on the
target host. This patch ensures that in such cases there is always
a usable value.

Conflicts:
>------- playbooks/roles/galera_server/templates/mysql_defaults.j2

Change-Id: I504d2ae34ce587a3ea6639e182d29303667139e3
(cherry picked from commit f7f3b5007a6a1fdfd09acb079ef2158d80050dfe)

commit_message:
Ensure that ansible_processor_vcpus always has a default value

In some cases Ansible does not detect the number of CPU's on the
target host. This patch ensures that in such cases there is always
a usable value.

Change-Id: I504d2ae34ce587a3ea6639e182d29303667139e3
(cherry picked from commit f7f3b5007a6a1fdfd09acb079ef2158d80050dfe)

commit_message:
Reverts image_meta to dictionary

Current driver behaviour relies on the fact that the
image_meta is a dictionary. Additionally, when converted
to an object, some image metadata properties are lost,
which is undesirable.

Change-Id: Iad23ae407e372018a0fcd895dffbac8a5758c66b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv refs/changes/07/270507/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova import image self._image_api = image.API() image_meta = self._recreate_image_meta(context, image_meta) image_meta = self._recreate_image_meta(context, image_meta) image_meta = self._recreate_image_meta(context, image_meta) def _recreate_image_meta(self, context, image_meta): image_ref = image_meta.id image_meta = self._image_api.get(context, image_ref) image_meta["id"] = image_ref return image_meta

commit_message:
Use puppet-openstack_spec_helper for Rakefile & spec_helper_acceptance

Use common code in puppet-openstack_spec_helper in Rakefile and
spec_helper_acceptance.

Change-Id: Id51d1febdf0416e2f3b739e76418d97e55f5e18a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-mistral refs/changes/89/269089/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'puppet-openstack_spec_helper/beaker_spec_helper'
deleted_lines: require 'beaker-rspec' require 'beaker/puppet_install_helper' run_puppet_install_helper RSpec.configure do |c| # Project root proj_root = File.expand_path(File.join(File.dirname(__FILE__), '..')) modname = JSON.parse(open('metadata.json').read)['name'].split('-')[1] # Readable test descriptions c.formatter = :documentation # Configure all nodes in nodeset c.before :suite do # Install module and dependencies hosts.each do |host| # install git install_package host, 'git' zuul_ref = ENV['ZUUL_REF'] zuul_branch = ENV['ZUUL_BRANCH'] zuul_url = ENV['ZUUL_URL'] repo = 'openstack/puppet-openstack-integration' # Start out with clean moduledir, don't trust r10k to purge it on host, "rm -rf /etc/puppet/modules/*" # Install dependent modules via git or zuul r = on host, "test -e /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner", { :acceptable_exit_codes => [0,1] } if r.exit_code == 0 zuul_clone_cmd = '/usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ' zuul_clone_cmd += '--cache-dir /opt/git ' zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-ref #{zuul_ref} " zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-branch #{zuul_branch} " zuul_clone_cmd += "--zuul-url #{zuul_url} " zuul_clone_cmd += "git://git.openstack.org #{repo}" on host, zuul_clone_cmd else on host, "git clone https://git.openstack.org/#{repo} #{repo}" end on host, "ZUUL_REF=#{zuul_ref} ZUUL_BRANCH=#{zuul_branch} ZUUL_URL=#{zuul_url} bash #{repo}/install_modules.sh" # Install the module being tested on host, "rm -fr /etc/puppet/modules/#{modname}" puppet_module_install(:source => proj_root, :module_name => modname) on host, "rm -fr #{repo}" # List modules installed to help with debugging on host, puppet('module','list'), { :acceptable_exit_codes => 0 } end end end

In openstack_extras_repo_spec, we hardcode the version of the release.

commit_message:
bump to mitaka

In openstack_extras_repo_spec, we hardcode the version of the release.
It was liberty, it's now mitaka since our recent CI bump.

Change-Id: I90b6f0bbeb76c870f0ab26cf0ff9bdcbb0cb5ca8
Partial-Bug: #1535382

commit_message:
Point Horizon to the internalURL endpoints as primary option

Horizon can use a primary and a secondary endpoint type; both
default to 'publicURL', with this change we point the preferred
endpoint to 'internalURL' which should always be resolvable
also when deploying with SSL and using a custom CloudName for the
public endpoints.

Change-Id: Ifa6f947e9271ee3f549f38368316ea28f9c53cd7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/42/270342/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: horizon::openstack_endpoint_type: 'internalURL'

subject: Don't write CLOUDNAME to the hosts file.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-15 03:28:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/8fa1ea96b8ffa24f29c33372700fd48f7b18034b', 'message': "Don't write CLOUDNAME to the hosts file.

Currently the value of the CloudName param gets written into the
/etc/hosts file on each controller, but it turns out this is an
invalid configuration.  CloudName is supposed to be the DNS name
of the overcloud, and the IP being written is (at least in my case)
the internal API VIP.  This breaks in cases such as SSL because
the services are not listening on an SSL port on the internal API
network, so if a service tries to talk to another service using a
CloudName-defined public endpoint it ends up pointed at a
non-existent internal address:port.

Since by definition CloudName is supposed to be resolvable by the
configured DNS server, we should not need an explicit hosts entry
as well.  Thus, this patch removes that from the file.

Change-Id: I919b42a219d95296f46852dd3266a54d968cf66b

commit_message:
Don't write CLOUDNAME to the hosts file.

Currently the value of the CloudName param gets written into the
/etc/hosts file on each controller, but it turns out this is an
invalid configuration.  CloudName is supposed to be the DNS name
of the overcloud, and the IP being written is (at least in my case)
the internal API VIP.  This breaks in cases such as SSL because
the services are not listening on an SSL port on the internal API
network, so if a service tries to talk to another service using a
CloudName-defined public endpoint it ends up pointed at a
non-existent internal address:port.

Since by definition CloudName is supposed to be resolvable by the
configured DNS server, we should not need an explicit hosts entry
as well.  Thus, this patch removes that from the file.

Change-Id: I919b42a219d95296f46852dd3266a54d968cf66b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/17/267917/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: template: IP HOST.DOMAIN HOST
deleted_lines: template: IP HOST.DOMAIN HOST CLOUDNAME CLOUDNAME: {get_param: CloudName}

commit_message:
Pass FUEL_WEB_CLONE variable to skip repo cloning

Required to run Fuel CI job
'verify-python-fuelclient-on-fuel-web' and keep
fuel-web repository from being cleaned before tests
are started. The job is implemented by this change:

* https://review.fuel-infra.org/#/c/14447/

Change-Id: Iac01b6647bd2d3afd44b9f49671d77b1ea461fbc
Related-Bug: #1466897

commit_message:
/NetworkDriver.CreateNetwork: Handle 'Gateway' parameter properly

'Gateway' may be or may not be present in the input json data received
from libnetwork depending on docker user command. If present use it
while creating subnet.

Change-Id: I154023e502f925437a103b4b8b956778e9c09be1
Closes-Bug: #1533422

commit_message:
Make template verification tests simple-tables tolerant

Change-Id: Ide5a55adeedf5f4066ebb67264cf690f64e7cff9

commit_message:
pypowervm log level to INFO in local.conf samples

At DEBUG, pypowervm produces way too much information, including the
payload of every REST request & response.  Set the log level to the
more-reasonable INFO in our sample local.conf files for compute and
all-in-one nodes.

Change-Id: Ie8b1abed5106902046bb36c39fbc980a9e481f12

commit_message:
Change metavar for location commands in V2

Currently location-add, location-delete and location-update
shows <ID> in help messages as metavar for image id. It may be
not clear to the users so we need to change this to <IMAGE_ID>.

Change-Id: I59c787e449fa34bc792de179993c55f59734b9fe
Closes-Bug: #1535220

commit_message:
Separate execute and revert arg mapping (WIP)

This makes Atom mutable so you can modify requires, provides,
etc after creating the object.  It also lets you rebuild the
argument mapping for a different method other than the default
'execute'.  So now revert methods can take a different set of
arguments from execute methods and it'll do the right thing.

Change-Id: Ib482dd68480910b9db7b96d4c7b06ab7f4022d56
Implements: blueprint separate-revert-args

self._save_as, since they're # tightly coupled self._update_provides(provides) self._arg_mapping_kwargs = {} self._requires = sets.OrderedSet() self._optional = sets.OrderedSet() self._rebind = collections.OrderedDict() self._arg_mapping_method_name = self.default_execute_method self._build_arg_mapping(requires=requires, rebind=rebind, auto_extract=auto_extract, def _build_arg_mapping(self, requires=None, rebind=None, self._arg_mapping_kwargs = {'requires': requires, 'rebind': rebind, 'auto_extract': auto_extract, 'ignore_list': ignore_list} method_to_map = getattr(self, self._arg_mapping_method_name) method_to_map, auto_extract, self._rebind = rebind self._requires = sets.OrderedSet(six.itervalues(required)) self._optional = sets.OrderedSet(six.itervalues(optional)) self._requires -= inject_keys self._optional -= inject_keys def _rebuild_arg_mapping(self, **kwargs): arg_mapping_kwargs = dict(self._arg_mapping_kwargs) arg_mapping_kwargs.update(kwargs) self._build_arg_mapping(**arg_mapping_kwargs) def remap_args_for_revert(self, **kwargs): self._arg_mapping_method_name = 'revert' self._rebuild_arg_mapping(**kwargs) def remap_args_for_execute(self, **kwargs): self._arg_mapping_method_name = 'execute' self._rebuild_arg_mapping(**kwargs) @property def save_as(self): return self._save_as @property def provides(self): return self._provides @provides.setter def provides(self, provides): self._update_provides(provides) return self._provides def _update_provides(self, provides): self._save_as = _save_as_to_mapping(provides) self._provides = sets.OrderedSet(self._save_as) return self._provides @property def rebind(self): return self._rebind @rebind.setter def rebind(self, rebind): self._rebuild_arg_mapping(rebind=rebind) return self._rebind @property def requires(self): return self._requires @requires.setter def requires(self, requires): self._rebuild_arg_mapping(requires=requires) return self._requires @property def optional(self): return self._optional @optional.setter def optional(self, optional): self._rebuild_arg_mapping(optional=optional) return self._optional

commit_message:
Initial commit for openstack-client support in python-muranoclient

This patch enables openstack-client support in python-muranoclient
by setting entry points and implementing two interface functions
`make_client(instance)` and `build_option_parser(parser)`.

Change-Id: I9bd9b9718377e1eb7324d19ee7b0292f18eb22d5
Partially implements: blueprint openstack-client-plugin-support

script: name: git_checkout user: rally data: | dig github.com env df -h retry () { n=0 until [ $n -ge 5 ] do n=$[$n+1] timeout 60 "$@" && break echo "Retry in 15 seconds" sleep 15 done } PROJECT=${GERRIT_PROJECT:-$GERRIT_REFUPD_PROJECT} cd "/var/repos/$PROJECT" git checkout master && git pull if [ -n "$GERRIT_REF" ]; then retry git fetch https://review.openstack.org/$PROJECT $GERRIT_REF git checkout FETCH_HEAD && git rebase master else git checkout $GERRIT_REFUPD_NEW fi git status git diff --name-only master - script: name: pull_ubuntu_1404 user: rally data: | n=0 until [ $n -ge 5 ] do n=$[$n+1] docker pull ubuntu:14.04 && break echo "Retry in 5 seconds" sleep 5 done - script: name: rally_docker_push user: rally data: | docker --version pushd /home/rally/rally mkdir /tmp/df || true cat >/tmp/df/Dockerfile<<EOF FROM image-flat MAINTAINER Sergey Skripnick <sskripnick@mirantis.com> VOLUME ["/home/rally"] WORKDIR /home/rally USER rally ENV HOME /home/rally CMD ["bash", "--login"] EOF build_and_push () { TAG=$1 sudo docker build --no-cache -t image-built . || return 1 docker run image-built rally deployment list id=$(docker ps -aq | head -n 1) docker export $id > /tmp/rc.tar docker import - image-flat < /tmp/rc.tar pushd /tmp/df sudo docker build -t rallyforge/rally:$TAG . /usr/bin/docker run rallyforge/rally:$TAG rally version sudo /usr/bin/docker push rallyforge/rally:$TAG popd } substr () { echo "$2" | grep "$1" } build_and_push latest tags=$(curl https://index.docker.io/v1/repositories/rallyforge/rally/tags) for tag in $(git tag | grep -v '0\.0\.[1-3]'); do if substr "$tag" "$tags"; then echo $tag already in repo else echo Pushing $tag git checkout $tag build_and_push $tag || true fi done popd - script: name: install_docker data: | apt-get --force-yes -y update && apt-get --force-yes -y upgrade apt-get --force-yes -y install docker.io usermod -a -G docker rally || true - script: name: install_docker_push data: | echo 'rally ALL=NOPASSWD:/usr/bin/docker push rallyforge*' > /etc/sudoers.d/rally-docker-push echo 'rally ALL=NOPASSWD:/usr/bin/docker build *' >> /etc/sudoers.d/rally-docker-push - script: name: install_rally data: | RALLY_DIR=/var/repos/openstack/rally VENV=${RALLY_DIR}/.venv RCI_PYTHON=${RCI_PYTHON:-python} cd $RALLY_DIR apt-get -y install python-virtualenv && virtualenv $VENV -p $RCI_PYTHON RCI_PYTHON=${VENV}/bin/python sudo rm -fr /root/.cache/pip $RCI_PYTHON -m pip install -r requirements.txt -r test-requirements.txt -r optional-requirements.txt $RCI_PYTHON setup.py build $RCI_PYTHON setup.py install mkdir /etc/rally cp etc/rally/rally.conf.sample /etc/rally/rally.conf sed -i 's|^.*sahara_cluster_create_timeout.*$|sahara_cluster_create_timeout=6000|' /etc/rally/rally.conf ln -s ${VENV}/bin/rally /usr/local/bin/ ln -s ${VENV}/bin/rally-manage /usr/local/bin/ if [ -n "RALLY_POSTGRES" ]; then unset LANG unset ${!LC_*} apt-get --force-yes -y install postgresql sudo -i -u postgres createuser -s -d -r -l rally sudo -i -u postgres createdb --owner=rally rally sed -i 's|#connection *=.*|connection=postgresql:///rally?host=/var/run/postgresql|' /etc/rally/rally.conf $RCI_PYTHON -m pip install psycopg2 fi if [ -n "RALLY_MYSQL" ]; then unset LANG unset ${!LC_*} echo "mysql-server mysql-server/root_password password r00tme" | debconf-set-selections echo "mysql-server mysql-server/root_password_again password r00tme" | debconf-set-selections apt-get --force-yes -y install mysql-server libmysqlclient-dev mysql -u root -pr00tme -e "create database rally;" mysql -u root -pr00tme -e "create user 'rally'@'localhost' identified by 'rally';" mysql -u root -pr00tme -e "grant all on rally.* to 'rally'@'localhost';" sed -i 's|#connection *=.*|connection=mysql://rally:rally@localhost/rally|' /etc/rally/rally.conf $RCI_PYTHON -m pip install mysql-python fi sudo -u rally /usr/local/bin/rally-manage db recreate - subject: Fix cinder create volume from image with kolla source build
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-21 08:32:57.000000000', 'files': ['docker/cinder/cinder-base/cinder_sudoers', 'docker/cinder/cinder-base/Dockerfile.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/f92151465b84164933e7660d9a9e91da9226bd5a', 'message': 'Fix cinder create volume from image with kolla source build

After recent drop root changes, all cinder rootwrap calls will fail in source
build because lack of sudoer setting. This change adds sudoer file to enable
rootwrap. It also add missing package dependencies needed for volume from image
in source build type.

Change-Id: I63a2405fb962ac687cdd88c81e1cdc02b3da638d
Closes-Bug: #1536514
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder create volume from image with kolla source build

After recent drop root changes, all cinder rootwrap calls will fail in source
build because lack of sudoer setting. This change adds sudoer file to enable
rootwrap. It also add missing package dependencies needed for volume from image
in source build type.

Change-Id: I63a2405fb962ac687cdd88c81e1cdc02b3da638d
Closes-Bug: #1536514
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/61/270661/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RUN yum -y install \ lvm2 \ qemu-img \ qemu-utils \COPY cinder_sudoers /etc/sudoers.d/cinder_sudoers RUN chmod 750 /etc/sudoers.d \ && chmod 440 /etc/sudoers.d/cinder_sudoers

commit_message:
Do not inherit File owning permissions for apache module

Change-Id: I45fb8e028a5231433e309dc97d213d0d9c36eb25
Closes-bug: #1535663
(cherry picked from commit 8d62e08d6102893282e8f0dc3e860c0587cc508e)

added_lines: # TODO (vvalyavskiy) Currently, it's not possible to specify owning parameters for File resource, # cause it breaks apache logging process. Optimization can be returned as soon as pull request # will be merged - https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/pull/1340 ensure => 'file', owner => 'root', group => 'root', ensure => 'directory', owner => 'root', group => 'root', mode => '0755', ensure => 'file', owner => 'root', group => 'root',}

commit_message:
Add some swap to the undercloud

Add validate scrits to linters

non-conflicting jobs as we have already done with pep8 and bashate

TrivialFix

Add devstack plugin for kafka

Adding devstack plugin for kafka to prepare for making
the integration test environment of KafkaDriver

Depends-On: I7a5d8e3259b21d5e29ed3b795d04952e1d13ad08
Change-Id: I124f1c5a7e86e5b34d97540a0c37148b3b57a069
Implements: blueprint adding-kafka-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/22/227522/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # lib/kafka # Functions to control the configuration and operation of the Kafka messaging service # # Dependencies: # - ``functions`` file # # ``stack.sh`` calls the entry points in this order (via ``extras.d/40-kafka.sh``): # - download_kafka # - install_kafka # - configure_kafka # - init_kafka # - stop_kafka # - cleanup_kafka # Save trace setting XTRACE=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set +o xtrace # Functions # ------------ # download_kafka() - downloading kafka function download_kafka { if [ ! -f ${FILES}/kafka_${SCALA_VERSION}-${KAFKA_VERSION}.tgz ]; then wget ${KAFKA_BASEURL}/${KAFKA_VERSION}/kafka_${SCALA_VERSION}-${KAFKA_VERSION}.tgz \ -O ${FILES}/kafka_${SCALA_VERSION}-${KAFKA_VERSION}.tgz fi } # install_kafka() - installing Kafka with Scala and Zookeeper function install_kafka { local scala_version=${SCALA_VERSION}.0 if is_ubuntu; then sudo apt-get install scala elif is_fedora; then is_package_installed java-1.8.0-openjdk-headless || install_package java-1.8.0-openjdk-headless if [ ! -f ${FILES}/scala-${scala_version}.tar.gz ]; then wget ${SCALA_BASEURL}/scala-${scala_version}.tgz \ -O ${FILES}/scala-${scala_version}.tar.gz fi if [ ! -d ${FILES}/scala-${scala_version} ]; then tar -xvzf ${FILES}/scala-${scala_version}.tar.gz -C ${FILES} fi if [ ! -d /usr/lib/scala-${scala_version} ]; then sudo mv ${FILES}/scala-${scala_version} /usr/lib sudo ln -s /usr/lib/scala-${scala_version} /usr/lib/scala export PATH=$PATH:/usr/lib/scala/bin fi fi download_kafka if [ ! -d ${FILES}/kafka_${SCALA_VERSION}-${KAFKA_VERSION} ]; then tar -xvzf ${FILES}/kafka_${SCALA_VERSION}-${KAFKA_VERSION}.tgz -C ${FILES} fi if [ ! -d ${KAFKA_DEST}/kafka ]; then mv ${FILES}/kafka_${SCALA_VERSION}-${KAFKA_VERSION} ${KAFKA_DEST}/kafka fi } # init_kafka() - starting Kafka and Zookeeper processes function init_kafka { # start Zookeeper process before starting Kafka ${KAFKA_DEST}/kafka/bin/zookeeper-server-start.sh -daemon ${KAFKA_DEST}/kafka/config/zookeeper.properties ${KAFKA_DEST}/kafka/bin/kafka-server-start.sh -daemon ${KAFKA_DEST}/kafka/config/server.properties } # configure_kafka() - configuring Kafka service function configure_kafka { # currently a no op : } # stop_kafka() - stopping Kafka process function stop_kafka { ${KAFKA_DEST}/kafka/bin/kafka-server-stop.sh ${KAFKA_DEST}/kafka/bin/zookeeper-server-stop.sh } # cleanup_kafka() - removing Kafka files # make sure this function is called only after calling stop_kafka() function function cleanup_kafka { rm ${FILES}/kafka_${SCALA_VERSION}-${KAFKA_VERSION}.tgz rm -rf ${KAFKA_DEST}/kafka } # check for kafka service if is_service_enabled kafka; then if [[ "$1" == "source" ]]; then # Initial source source $TOP_DIR/lib/kafka elif [[ "$1" == "stack" && "$2" == "install" ]]; then # Perform installation of service source echo_summary "Installing kafka" install_kafka echo_summary "Initializing kafka" init_kafka elif [[ "$1" == "unstack" ]]; then # Shut down kafka services echo_summary "Shut down kafka service" stop_kafka elif [[ "$1" == "clean" ]]; then # Remove state and transient data # Remember clean.sh first calls unstack.sh echo_summary "Clean up kafka service" cleanup_kafka fi fi # Restore xtrace $XTRACE ## Local variables: ## mode: shell-script ## End:

commit_message:
Add uppercase env var names for consistency

Some env var names (the vars starting with manilaclient_) are mixing
lower and uppercase. To be consistent with the other env vars (and
also with env vars from other openstack client projects), add also
the only-upper-case var names. Newly added env variables are:

- MANILACLIENT_UUID_CACHE_DIR
- MANILACLIENT_DEBUG
- MANILACLIENT_INSECURE

Closes-bug: #1535284
Change-Id: Ifd43c6d226487d2b1c4ec099096595373725e596

commit_message:
Implement prefixed hostnames support

in the network_metadata_to_hosts() parser function.

This functional required for separation nova live migration
and RMQ-server to dedicated networks.

Change-Id: I9813fa8c20d47e0ef1e251fe5ac8d01d08fe7703
Related-bug: 1528707
(cherry picked from commit 68bcee4af6fb707ca8ad3fe3fbc831b98a1d27cd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/37/269637/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Call network_metadata_to_hosts(network_metadata, 'network/role', 'optional_prefix') unless args.size == 1 or args.size == 3 raise(Puppet::ParseError, 'network_metadata_to_hosts(): Wrong number of arguments, need one or three') end hosts = Hash.new nodes = args[0].fetch('nodes', {}) network_role = (args[1].to_s == '' ? 'mgmt/vip' : args[1].to_s) prefix = args[2].to_s fqdn = "#{prefix}#{props['fqdn']}" hosts[fqdn]={:ip=>props['network_roles'][network_role],:host_aliases=>["#{prefix}#{name}"]} notice("Generating host entry #{name} #{props['network_roles'][network_role]} #{props['fqdn']}")# vim: set ts=2 sw=2 et :
deleted_lines: hosts=Hash.new nodes=args[0].fetch('nodes', {}) hosts[props['fqdn']]={:ip=>props['network_roles']['mgmt/vip'],:host_aliases=>[name]} notice("Generating host entry #{name} #{props['network_roles']['mgmt/vip']} #{props['fqdn']}")# vim: set ts=2 sw=2 et :

commit_message:
Remove usage of tempest venv generator

- This patch removes usage of tempest venv in functional test hooks to
avoid installation of pip 8.0.0 into tempest venv.
- This patch unlocks main murano gate.

Change-Id: I90fcd4ce526105b2d31747a6c1447047325d469b
Closes-Bug: #1536614

commit_message:
properly sign a certificate without bay name

When sign a self-signed certificate, bay.name is used as issuer_name,
but when we create a bay without name, this process will fail. Fix it.

Change-Id: I02c73769b97ab58b435e3211c218e62f7aaef4e4
Closes-Bug: #1535825

commit_message:
[Django 1.9] Replace django.utils.unittest

This patch replaces django.utils.unittest with unittest.
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.9/releases/1.7/#django-utils-unittest

Change-Id: Ifd6138c5afa4a3e952989bf9bb73076c51f1898b
Partially-implements: blueprint drop-dj17
