commit_message:
Deprecate auth_* old parameters

This patch does multiple things regarding auth_* parameters.

1/ We deprecate auth_host, auth_url, auth_port and auth_protocol
If they are set, a nice warning will show up and mention the parameters
will be dropped in a future release. The parameters are still having
effect but will configure old parameters. No worries, they still work.
Just lot of warnings so people will have to use new parameters.

2/ Add new parameters
auth_uri and identity_uri are the way to go!
False by default for now, because we still have old parameters, but in a
later release, they'll be set to a default endpoint, like in other
modules.

3/ Update beaker
We want to test with the new parameters, so let's update beaker
manifests and use auth_uri & identity_uri

This is a first step to use auth_uri & identity_uri that is compliant
with other modules. The next step will be to drop old parameters and set
the right default values for the 2 new params.

Change-Id: I66d5233c8981763a0a341740911fb24dd0e8d479
Closes-bug: #1504653
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-trove refs/changes/29/233229/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*auth_uri*] # (Optional) Complete public Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0/'.# [*identity_uri*] # (Optional) Complete admin Identity API endpoint. # This should specify the unversioned root endpoint. # Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:35357/'.# == DEPRECATED PARAMETERS # # [*auth_host*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use identity_uri instead. # Host running auth service. # Defaults to undef. # # [*auth_port*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use identity_uri instead. # Port to use for auth service on auth_host. # Defaults to undef. # # [*auth_protocol*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use identity_uri instead. # Protocol to use for auth. # Defaults to undef. # # [*auth_url*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use auth_uri instead. # Authentication URL. # Defaults to undef. # $auth_uri = 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0/', $identity_uri = 'http://127.0.0.1:35357/', # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $auth_host = undef, $auth_url = false, $auth_port = undef, $auth_protocol = undef, warning('The auth_url parameter is deprecated. Use auth_uri parameter instead') $auth_uri_real = $auth_url } else { $auth_uri_real = $auth_uri if $auth_host or $auth_port or $auth_protocol { if $auth_host { warning('The auth_host parameter is deprecated. Use identity_uri parameter instead') $auth_host_real = $auth_host } else { $auth_host_real = "127.0.0.1" } if $auth_port { warning('The auth_port parameter is deprecated. Use identity_uri parameter instead') $auth_port_real = $auth_port } else { $auth_port_real = '35357' } if $auth_protocol { warning('The auth_protocol parameter is deprecated. Use identity_uri parameter instead') $auth_protocol_real = $auth_protocol } else { $auth_protocol_real = 'http' } $identity_uri_real = "${auth_protocol}://${auth_host}:${auth_port}" } else { $identity_uri_real = $identity_uri } trove_config { 'DEFAULT/trove_auth_url': value => $auth_uri_real; 'keystone_authtoken/auth_uri': value => $auth_uri_real; 'keystone_authtoken/identity_uri': value => $identity_uri_real;
deleted_lines: # [*auth_host*] # (optional) Host running auth service. # Defaults to '127.0.0.1'.# [*auth_url*] # (optional) Authentication URL. # Defaults to 'http://localhost:5000/v2.0'. # # [*auth_port*] # (optional) Port to use for auth service on auth_host. # Defaults to '35357'. # # [*auth_protocol*] # (optional) Protocol to use for auth. # Defaults to 'http'. $auth_host = '127.0.0.1', $auth_url = false, $auth_port = '35357', $auth_protocol = 'http', trove_config { 'DEFAULT/trove_auth_url': value => $auth_url; } } else { trove_config { 'DEFAULT/trove_auth_url': value => "${auth_protocol}://${auth_host}:5000/v2.0"; } trove_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_host': value => $auth_host; 'keystone_authtoken/auth_port': value => $auth_port; 'keystone_authtoken/auth_protocol': value => $auth_protocol;

subject: Implement Neutron LBAAS using haproxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-03 16:30:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/6d00e5fd40a191af34528a2466507fe3fc790f30', 'message': "Implement Neutron LBAAS using haproxy

This patch implements the LBAAS agent using haproxy into the
neutron_agents container group.

The neutron-lbaas-agent service is disabled by default but can be
enabled by setting neutron_plugin_base in user_variables to include
'neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPlugin'.

The LBaaS Agent conf file entries can be set using the dict
'neutron_lbaas_agent_ini_overrides'

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1491968
Co-Authored-By: Serge van Ginderachter <serge@vanginderachter.be>

Change-Id: I0a4ed3e2d38b7f3d982bea0a934ff411acfe8de6

commit_message:
Implement Neutron LBAAS using haproxy

This patch implements the LBAAS agent using haproxy into the
neutron_agents container group.

The neutron-lbaas-agent service is disabled by default but can be
enabled by setting neutron_plugin_base in user_variables to include
'neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPlugin'.

The LBaaS Agent conf file entries can be set using the dict
'neutron_lbaas_agent_ini_overrides'

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1491968
Co-Authored-By: Serge van Ginderachter <serge@vanginderachter.be>

Change-Id: I0a4ed3e2d38b7f3d982bea0a934ff411acfe8de6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/82/241282/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # {{ ansible_managed }} [DEFAULT] # Show debugging output in log (sets DEBUG log level output). verbose = {{ verbose | bool }} debug = {{ debug | bool }} # The LBaaS agent will resync its state with Neutron to recover from any # transient notification or rpc errors. The interval is number of # seconds between attempts. periodic_interval = 10 # LBaas requires an interface driver be set. Choose the one that best # matches your plugin. # Examples: # interface_driver = neutron.agent.linux.interface.OVSInterfaceDriver # interface_driver = neutron.agent.linux.interface.BridgeInterfaceDriver interface_driver = {{ neutron_driver_interface }} # Use veth for an OVS interface or not. # Support kernels with limited namespace support # (e.g. RHEL 6.5) so long as ovs_use_veth is set to True. # ovs_use_veth = False # The agent requires drivers to manage the loadbalancer. HAProxy is the opensource version. # Multiple device drivers reflecting different service providers could be specified: # device_driver = path.to.provider1.driver.Driver # device_driver = path.to.provider2.driver.Driver # Default is: device_driver = neutron_lbaas.services.loadbalancer.drivers.haproxy.namespace_driver.HaproxyNSDriver [haproxy] # Location to store config and state files # loadbalancer_state_path = $state_path/lbaas # The user group user_group = nogroup # When delete and re-add the same vip, send this many gratuitous ARPs to flush # the ARP cache in the Router. Set it below or equal to 0 to disable this feature. send_gratuitous_arp = 3

commit_message:
Make gate-fuel-library-puppet-syntax-4-dsvm-centos7 job voting in the check queue

fuel-library completly cleaned for properly support Puppet4
so let's make the job a voting job again in the check queue
only for the master branch.

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import pecan from oslo_log import log from pecan.core import abort from pecan import rest from vitrage.api.policy import enforce LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class ResourcesController(rest.RestController): @pecan.expose() def _lookup(self, id, *remainder): return ResourceController(id), remainder @pecan.expose('json') def get_all(self, **kwargs): enforce("list resources", pecan.request.headers, pecan.request.enforcer, {}) try: return self.get_resources() except Exception as e: LOG.exception("failed to get resources %s", e) abort(404, str(e)) @staticmethod def get_resources(): return dict() class ResourceController(rest.RestController): def __init__(self, id_): self.id = id_ @pecan.expose('json') def get(self): enforce("get resource", pecan.request.headers, pecan.request.enforcer, {}) try: return self.get_resource(id) except Exception as e: LOG.exception("failed to get resource %s", e) abort(404, str(e)) @staticmethod def get_resource(id_): return dict()

commit_message:
Adds openstack-doc-tools as a group for doc tools

Includes fairy-slipper and openstack-doc-tools. I don't
see clouddocs-maven-plugin but that'll be obsolete soon.

While fairy-slipper will create output for the api-site,
it also is a doc tool.

Change-Id: If26885c321dbdb60e09279fa4f43abffa5a2b55b

commit_message:
reraised exceptions are updated as "excutils.save_and_reraise_exception".

excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() should be used instead of
re-raise as in some cases the exception context can be cleared,
resulting in None being attempted to be re-raised after an exception
handler is run (see excutils.save_and_reraise_exception for more).

Closes-Bug:#1281453
Change-Id: I11d6eaeb6afaaf9cd284178447e337d0bcadd3f8

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-16 08:14:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/v3/test_fixed_ips.py', 'nova/tests/functional/v3/api_sample_base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/83e202463cbf6cb8ebb8ada241a3f846ca6320d2', 'message': 'Add top,bottom & change version tests for microversion 2.4

As discussed in Vancouver summit, each microversion should be
tested against top, bottom and change versions.
top- itself
bottom-2.1
change -previous version

Currently microversion 2.4 is being tested against top (which was 2.4)
version only.

This commits add bottom and change version tests for v2.4 and make sure
version 2.1(bottom) and 2.3(change) behave as expected where
2.4 changes should not reflect.

If this approach looks fine, follow up patch need to add the same testing for all
other microversions.

Change-Id: I55deb44f7c442761ed83b0ef29ac2eb1b68cc0bb
'}]
commit_message:
Add top,bottom & change version tests for microversion 2.4

As discussed in Vancouver summit, each microversion should be
tested against top, bottom and change versions.
top- itself
bottom-2.1
change -previous version

Currently microversion 2.4 is being tested against top (which was 2.4)
version only.

This commits add bottom and change version tests for v2.4 and make sure
version 2.1(bottom) and 2.3(change) behave as expected where
2.4 changes should not reflect.

If this approach looks fine, follow up patch need to add the same testing for all
other microversions.

Change-Id: I55deb44f7c442761ed83b0ef29ac2eb1b68cc0bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/31/202431/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Change message of InvalidBDMBootSequense
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-15 17:16:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1f956454443bc2a98738ea28fba946b90301804e', 'message': 'Raise correct exception

While validating boot indexes InvalidBDMBootSequense was raised.
But without message this exception is quite misleading - looks like
source or source id was specified incorrectly.
So now this validation raises InvalidBDMFormat exception, which is
quite closer to this case than invalid boor sequence.

commit_message:
Change message of InvalidBDMBootSequense

Current message this exception is quite misleading - looks like
source or source id was specified incorrectly. But this exception
is never raised in such case.
So fill message with details and raise it with correct ones.

Change-Id: I5bba1a25d30500b000e95dcd6324fcb43138f694
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/191909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = _("Incorrect boot index") raise exception.InvalidBDMFormat(details=msg)

commit_message:
Fix nova backup for volume-backed instance

Now nova backup doesn't honour the volume-backed instance. This
patch will fix the issue by checking the instance is volume-backed
and then call existing snapshot_volume_backed method to handle the
image creating.

Note: For volume-backed instance, the instance can't be backed up
if its vm_state is in PAUSED or SUSPENDED.

blueprint backup-volume-backed-instance
Closes-Bug: #1313573

Change-Id: Idbd11ec0f3d65d2a23d601ee4cbb89e29e6ea964

commit_message:
Adopt sorting guidelines for GET servers

In kilo, commit I02baf6c3cc7d29abab132ef1726140c57e17d9b6 added sorting
support in the GET servers API; the design used repeating 'sort_key' and
'sort_dir' query string parameters to generate a list of sort keys and
directions.

Note that the sort parameter processing was completed in the commit
I4253bc7d43142b783c14096d2834f53dcc0b7d3f, this patch set will modify the
code that was added in this commit.

This patch set will change how the sorting parameters are honored to also
use a single 'sort' parameter based on the sorting guidelines defined at:
https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/
pagination_filter_sort.rst

The 'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' parameters are being deprecated and they
cannot be used with the new 'sort' parameter.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I7a17c691b73347e77be2e93469343ce7c02cc2bf

commit_message:
Check for volume size

Added check to ensure volume size
specified by user is greater than
the image size in boot from volume

If this is not checked upfront, the
VM calls cinder to attach a volume
with given OS installed which is not
available because of the size constraint.
So this VM goes into error state. This
check informs the user about the issue
upfront and prevents the VM from going
into error state.

API Impact: There is no API impact from
this change.
Change-Id: Ie72d4e87d5ca6ec64ba6795ecac50742d1e392e8
Closes-Bug:

commit_message:
Add hard stop server support in nova api

Nova only support to stop a server gracefully in
rest api, this patch adds hard stop server support.

Change-Id: Ifbaff7cbe383feb8403c14269392bfce823f35d2
Closes-Bug: #1465956
Implements: blueprint nova-api-force-stop-server
APIImpact: New parameter for os-stop api

commit_message:
Provide more duplicate VLAN network error info

When user tries to create a network which VLAN ID is already used by another network,
Network object will throw a DuplicateVlan exception. However, when the exception get
propagate to the API level, it is only treated as a regular exception. This fix is to
treat DuplicateVlan exception as a special exception (similar to DuplicateCidr) so that
users know more about what kind of duplicated setting they configured.

Change-Id: I45f006bae33855037a39f7eb4dc8ff1716459a6a
Closes-Bug: #1420112
